Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common.path

Class PathWalker

java.lang.Object
nl.naturalis.common.path.PathWalker
public final class PathWalker extends Object
A PathWalker lets you read and write deeply nested values using Path objects. The PathWalker class is useful for reading large batches of sparsely populated objects. For some of these objects, the PathWalker may not be able to follow the path all the way to the end, for example because it hit a null value before it reached the last path segment, or because it hit a terminal value like a primitive or a String. By default, this will not cause the PathWalker to throw an exception. It will just return null.

      public PathWalker(List<Path> paths, PathWalker.OnError onError)

      onError - The action to take if the PathWalker hits a dead end

    • PathWalker

      public PathWalker(List<Path> paths, PathWalker.OnError onError, Function<Path,Object> keyDeserializer)
      Creates a PathWalker for the specified paths.
      Parameters:
      paths - The paths to walk
      onError - The action to take if a path could not be read or written
      keyDeserializer - A function that converts path segments to map keys. You need to provide this if the host objects are, or contain, Map instances with non-string keys. The function is given the path up to, and including the path segment that represents the key, and it should return the actual key

  • Method Details

    • readValues

      public Object[] readValues(Object host) throws PathWalkerException
      Returns the values of all paths within the specified host object.
      Parameters:
      host - The object to read the path values from
      Returns:
      The values of all paths within the specified host object
      Throws:
      PathWalkerException

    • readValues

      public void readValues(Object host, Object[] output) throws PathWalkerException
      Reads the values of all paths and places them in the provided output array. The length of the output array must be greater than or equal to the number of paths specified through the constructor.
      Parameters:
      host - The object from which to read the values
      output - An array into which to place the values
      Throws:
      PathWalkerException

    • readValues

      public void readValues(Object host, Map<Path,Object> output) throws PathWalkerException
      Reads the values of all paths and inserts them into the provided path-to-value map.
      Parameters:
      host - The object from which to read the values
      output - The Map into which to put the values
      Throws:
      PathWalkerException

    • read

      public <T> T read(Object host)
      Returns the value of the first path within the specified host object.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the value being returned
      Parameters:
      host - The object to walk
      Returns:
      The value referenced by the first path
      Throws:
      PathWalkerException

    • writeValues

      public ErrorCode writeValues(Object host, Object... values)
      Writes the specified values to the paths specified through the constructor. The number of values must equal the number of paths. If PathWalker.OnError is RETURN_CODE, this method turns into a fail-fast method, returning the ErrorCode of the first failed assignment, or ErrorCode.OK if all assignments succeeded. If PathWalker.OnError is OnDeadEnd#RETURN_NULL RETURN_NULL, this method always returns null and a write failure will not cause the method to be cut short.
      Parameters:
      host - The object to which to write the values
      values - The values to write
      Returns:
      null ot the ErrorCode of the first failed assignment

    • writeAll

      public ErrorCode[] writeAll(Object host, Object... values)
      Writes the specified values to the paths specified through the constructor. The number of values must equal the number of paths. A write failure will never cause this method to be cut short. If PathWalker.OnError is OnDeadEnd #RETURN_NULL RETURN_NULL, this method returns null. If it is OnDeadEnd#RETURN_CODE RETURN_CODE, an array of error codes is returned.
      Parameters:
      host - The object to which to write the values
      values - The values to write
      Returns:
      null or an array of ErrorCode instances, depending on the value of OnDeadEnd

    • write

      public ErrorCode write(Object host, Object value)
      Sets the value of the first path.
      Parameters:
      host - The object into which to write the value
      value - The value to write
      Returns:
      null or an ErrorCode, depending on the value of OnDeadEnd
